How can I plot a bar graph from a Pandas DataFrame to compare specific columns? 

Given a DataFrame that looks like this: 

```python
Hour | V1 | V2 | A1 | A2
 0   | 15 | 13 | 25 | 37  
 1   | 26 | 52 | 21 | 45 
 2   | 18 | 45 | 45 | 25 
 3   | 65 | 38 | 98 | 14
```

I am trying to create a bar plot to compare columns `V1` and `V2` by the `Hour` using the following code:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
ax = df.plot(kind='bar', title ="V comp",figsize=(15,10),legend=True, fontsize=12)
ax.set_xlabel("Hour",fontsize=12)
ax.set_ylabel("V",fontsize=12)
```

However, when I run this, I get a plot and a legend with all the columns' values and names. How can I modify my code so the plot and legend only displays the columns `V1` and `V2`?

To modify your code so that the bar plot and legend only display the columns `V1` and `V2`, you need to select these specific columns from your DataFrame before plotting. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming your DataFrame is named df
data = {
    'Hour': [0, 1, 2, 3],
    'V1': [15, 26, 18, 65],
    'V2': [13, 52, 45, 38],
    'A1': [25, 21, 45, 98],
    'A2': [37, 45, 25, 14]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Set 'Hour' as index to use it as the x-axis
df.set_index('Hour', inplace=True)

# Plot only the specified columns
ax = df[['V1', 'V2']].plot(kind='bar', title="V comp", figsize=(15, 10), legend=True, fontsize=12)
ax.set_xlabel("Hour", fontsize=12)
ax.set_ylabel("V", fontsize=12)

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

In this code, `df[['V1', 'V2']]` is used to select only the `V1` and `V2` columns for plotting. The `set_index('Hour', inplace=True)` line sets the `Hour` column as the index, which will be used for the x-axis in the bar plot. This way, the plot and legend will only include the values and names for `V1` and `V2`.
